lines.text: When I first came to this town I was gonna be - oh, there were a lot of things I was gonna do. Become famous. But Chicago's the big melting pot, and I got melted, but good.
How did a man in your frame of mind ever become a cop in the first place?
So, you're leaving the police and your wife?
I tried my best to help you the same as I helped others in the past. You, Lydia, the first time I saw you...

[Interrupting]
I was selling coffee and hamburgers behind a counter in a railroad station.
Yes, I had an hour to kill.

[Bitterly]
And you used it to murder years of my life.
I know how you feel, Joe.
I don't think you have the slightest idea how I feel.
I feel like I'm in a cement mixer getting slowly chopped and pounded to death. I've seen all that I can stand to see.
I've stolen a lot of things in my life but never someone's wife.
